name: Empty Cloak
damage_resistances: bludgeoning
languages: understands Elvish and Umbral but can't speak

special_abilities.name: Diligent Sentinal
special_abilities.desc: Empty cloaks are designed to watch for intruders. They gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks.

special_abilities.name: Shadow Construction
special_abilities.desc: Empty cloaks are designed with a delicate shadow construction. They burst into pieces, then dissipate into shadow, on a critical hit.

special_abilities.name: Wrapping Embrace
special_abilities.desc: Empty cloaks can share the same space as one Medium or smaller creature. The empty cloak has advantage on attack rolls against any creature in the same space with it.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage

actions.name: Shadow Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage

actions.name: Shadow Snare: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 20/60 ft, one target. Hit: Large or smaller creatures are restrained. To escape, the restrained creature or adjacent ally must use an action to make a successful DC 14 Strength check. The shadow snare has 15 hit points and AC 12.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The eonic drifter can either use Drift Backward or make two attacks with its time warping staff. The eonic drifter's future self (if present) can only use drift forward.

actions.name: Time Warping Staff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: +7 (1d10 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Drift Backward (1/Day)
actions.desc: A future self of the eonic drifter materializes in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of the drifter. The future self has the eonic drifter's stats and its full hit points, and it takes its turn immediately after its present self. Killing the original eonic drifter makes its future self disappear. If the present self sees its future self die, the eonic drifter must make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. There is n oeffect if the save succeeds. If the saving throw fails, roll 1d6 to determine the effect on the eonic drifter: 1 = frightened, 2 = incapacitated, 3 = paralyzed, 4 = unconscious, 5 or 6 = has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks. These effects last 1d4 rounds.

actions.name: Drift Forward (2/Day)
actions.desc: The future self makes a time warping staff attack against a target. If the attack hits, instead of causing bludgeoning damage both the target and the attacker jump forward through time, effectively ceasing to exist in the present time. They reappear in the same location 1d4 rounds later, at the end of the present self's turn. Creatures occupying those locations at the moment are pushed 5 feet in a direction of their own choosing. The target of the drift (but not the future self) must then make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw, with effects identical to those for the eonic drifter witnessing the death of its future self (see Drift Backward). The future self doesn't reappear after using this ability the second time; only the target of the drift reappears from the second use. This does not trigger a saving throw for the present self.

name: Erina Scrounger
damage_resistances: poison

special_abilities.name: Keen Smell
special_abilities.desc: The erina has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

special_abilities.name: Hardy
special_abilities.desc: The erina has advantage on saving throws against poison

special_abilities.name: Spines
special_abilities.desc: An enemy who hits the erina with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage

actions.name: Sling
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 30/120ft, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

name: Erina Defender
damage_resistances: poison

special_abilities.name: Keen Smell
special_abilities.desc: The erina has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

special_abilities.name: Hardy
special_abilities.desc: The erina has advantage on saving throws against poison

special_abilities.name: Spines
special_abilities.desc: An enemy who hits the erina with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The erina defender makes two attacks

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack, +4 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 80/320ft, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage

reactions.name: Protect
reactions.desc: The erina imposes disadvantage on an attack roll made against an ally within 5 feet of the erina defender

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.desc:
The far darrig's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components.

Constant: magic weapon (antler glaive only), speak with animals
At will: calm emotions, charm animal (as charm person but affects beasts only), cure wounds, detect poison and disease, water breathing, water walk
3/day: barkskin, conjure woodland beings, hold animal (as hold person but affects beasts only), jump, longstrider
1/day: commune with nature, freedom of movement, nondetection, tree stride

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The far darrig makes four antler glaive attacks.

actions.name: Antler Glaive
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5t, or 10ft, one target, Hit: 7 (1d10 +2) slashing damage and the target must make a successful DC 13 Strength saving throw or either be disarmed or fall prone; the attacking far darrig chooses which effect occurs

actions.name: Enchanted Glaive Maneuvers
actions.desc: A far darrig can magically extend or shrink its antler glaive as a bonus action to give it either a 10-foot or 5-foot reach

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.desc:
The fate eater's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 15). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
1/day each: blink, hallucinatory terrain

special_abilities.name: Visionary Flesh
special_abilities.desc: Eating the flesh of a fate eater requires a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. If successful, the eater gains a divination spell. If failed, the victim vomits blood and fails the next saving throw made in combat.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5ft, one target. Hit: 26 (5d8 + 4) slashing damage plus 11 (2d10) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Spectral Bite
actions.desc:
When a fate eater scores a critical hit against a target, it damages not only the creature but also the threads of its fate, changing the character's past or future. The target must roll 1d6 on the chart below for each critical hit that isn't negated by a successful DC 15 Charisma saving throw.

1 Seeing the Alternatives - Suffers the effects of the confusion spell for 1d4 rounds
2 Untied from the Loom - Character's speed is randomized for four rounds. Roll 3d20 at the start of each of the character's turns to determine his or her speed in feet that turn
3 Shifting Memories - Permanently loses 2 from a random skill and gains 2 in a random untrained skill
4 Not So Fast - Loses the use of one class ability, chosen at random
5 Lost Potential - Loses 1 point from one randomly chosed ability score
6 Took the Lesser Path - The character's current hit point total becomes his or her hit point maximum
Effect 3-6 are permanent until the character makes a successful Charisma saving throw. The saving throw is repeated after every long rest, but the DC increases by 1 after every long rest, as the character becomes more entrenched in this new destiny. Otherwise, these new fates can be undone by nothing short of a wish spell or comparable magic.

name: Fear Smith
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from weapons that aren't made of cold iron

special_abilities.name: Distortion Gaze
special_abilities.desc:
Those who meet the gaze of the fear smith experience the world seeming to twist at unnatural angles beneath their feet. When a creature that can see the fear smith's eye starts its turn within 30 feet of the fear smith, the creature must make a successful DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or become disoriented. While disoriented, the creature falls prone each time it tries to move or take the Dash or Disengage action. To recover from disorientation, a creature must start its turn outside the fear smith's gaze and make a successful DC 16 Wisdom saving throw.
To use this ability, the fear smith can't be incapacitated and must see the affected creature. A creature that isn't surprised can avert its eyes at the start of its turn to avoid the effect. In that case, no saving throw is necessary but the creature treats the fear smith as invisible until the start of the creature's next turn. If during its turn the creature chooses to look at the fear smith, it must immediately make the saving throw.

special_abilities.name: Hidden Eye
special_abilities.desc: The fear smith has advantage on saving throws against the blinded condition

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.desc:
The fear smith's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 16). The fear smith can innately cast the following spells, requiring no verbal or material components:
At will: detect thoughts, fear
2/day each: charm person, command, confusion

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.desc: The fear smith has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The fear smith makes three claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5ft, 1 creature. Hit: 16 (2d12 + 3) slashing damage. If the target is disoriented by Distorion Gaze, this attack does an addition 13 (3d8) psychic damage and heals the fear smith by an equal amount.

actions.name: Heartstopping Stare
actions.desc: The fear smith terrifies a creature within 30 feet with a look. The target must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be stunned for 1 round and take 13 (3d8) psychic damage and heal the fear smith by an equal amount.

name: Fellforged
damage_resistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning
languages: any languages it knew in life

special_abilities.name: Expelled Spirit
special_abilities.desc: While the body the fellforged inhabits was made to bind spirits, the foul presence of the wraith within is vulnerable to turning attempts. Any successful turn attempt exorcises the wraith from its clockwork frame, but has no other effect. The expelled wraith retains its current hp total.

special_abilities.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
special_abilities.desc: While in sunlight, the fellforged has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

special_abilities.name: Unnatural Aura
special_abilities.desc: All animals, whether wild or domesticated, can sense the unnatural presence of fellforged at a distance of 30 feet. They do not willingly approach nearer than that and panic if forced to do so, and they remain panicked as long as they are within that range.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The fellforged makes two necrotic slam attacks.

actions.name: Necrotic Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack. +5 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the total damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

actions.name: Violent Escapement
actions.desc: With little regard for the clockwork bodies they inhabit, fellforged wraiths can stress and strain their mechanisms in such a violent manner that flywheels become unbalanced, gears shatter, and springs snap. As a bonus action, this violent burst of gears and pulleys deal 7 (2d6) piercing damage to all foes within 5 feet who fail a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. Each use of this ability imposes a cumulative reduction in movement of 5 feet upon the fellforged. If its speed is reduced to 0 feet, the fellforged become paralyzed.

name: Fext
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage with nonmagical weapons
languages: the languages spoken by its patron

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.desc:
The fext's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components.

At will: hex
1/day each: hold monster, true seeing

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.desc: The fext has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

special_abilities.name: Magic Weapon
special_abilities.desc: The fext's weapon attacks are magical

special_abilities.name: Patron Blessing
special_abilities.desc: The fext is infused with a portion of their patrons power. They have an Armor Class equal to 10 + their Charisma modifier + their Dexterity modifier.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The fext makes two melee or ranged attacks

actions.name: Eldritch Blade
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 9 (2d6+2) slashing damage plus 16 (3d10) force damage.

actions.name: Eldritch Fury
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 60/200 ft, one creature. Hit: 25 (4d10 + 3) force damage.

name: Bear King
damage_resistances: cold
damage_immunities: poison; bludgeoning, slashing, and piercing from nonmagical weapons that aren't made of cold iron

special_abilities.name: Alternate Form
special_abilities.desc: As a bonus action, the Bear King canassume the form of a shaggy grizzly bear, or a hybrid of his humanoid and bear forms. In alternate form the Bear King's size increases to Large, and he can make bite and claw attacks. He remains in this form until he returns to human form as a bonus action or he falls unconscious or dies.

special_abilities.name: Keen Smell
special_abilities.desc: The Bear King has advantage on Perception (Wisdom) checks that rely on smell.

special_abilities.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day)
special_abilities.desc: If the Bear King fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

special_abilities.name: Regeneration (Alternate Form only)
special_abilities.desc: The Bear King regains 10 hit points at the start of his turn if he has at least 1 hit point.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The bear king makes two ranged attacks or two melee attacks. In hybrid or grizzly bear form he can also make one additional bite attack.

actions.name: Bite (Grizzly or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage. A target creature other than a construct or undead must make a successful DC 17 Constitution saving throw at the start of each of its turns or lose 10 (3d6) hit points from blood loss. Each time the Bear King hits the wounded creature with this attack, the hit point loss increases by 10 (3d6). A creature can take an action to staunch the bleeding on itself or an adjacent ally with a successful DC 12 Wisdom (Medicine) check. The bleeding also stops if the creature recieves any magical healing.

actions.name: Claws (Grizzly or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Maul (Human or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage. A creature hit by two maul attacks in the same turn must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or fall prone.

actions.name: Javelin (Human Form Only)
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 30/60 ft, one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage.

legendary_actions.name: Melee Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The Bear King makes a claw or maul attack.

legendary_actions.name: Honey Toss
legendary_actions.desc: The Bear King reaches into the jar he carries at his side and hurls a glob of honey at a target within 30 feet as a ranged weapon attack (+9 to hit). If the attack hits, the creature is restrained (escape DC 17).

legendary_actions.name: Frightful Roar (2 actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The Bear King lets out a blood-curdling roar. All creatures within 90 feet who can hear the Bear King must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. A creature that makes its save, or who the effect ends for, is immune to the Frightful Roar for 24 hours. The bear king's allies are unaffected.

name: Lord of the Hunt
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from weapons that aren't made of cold iron

special_abilities.name: Expert Rider
special_abilities.desc: While the Lord of the Hunt is mounted, any attack directed at his steed targets the rider instead. The steed uses the Lord of the Hunt's saving throws. If the mount succeeds on a saving throw against a damaging effect, it takes no damage.

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.desc:
The lord of the hunt's innate spellcasting ability score is Charisma (save DC 16). The Lord of the Hunt can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components.

At will:druidcraft, hunter's mark, phantom steed
3/day each: commune with nature, conjure volley.
1/day: conjure fey (conjured creatures vanish if the Lord of the Hunt's concentration is broken)

special_abilities.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day)
special_abilities.desc: If the Lord of the Hunt fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

special_abilities.name: Magic Weapons
special_abilities.desc: The Lord of the Hunt's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The Lord of the Hunt makes three melee attacks or three ranged attacks.

actions.name: Huntsman's Spear
actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60/120 ft, one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage or 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage if used in two hands, plus 7 (2d6) poison damage. If the target is acreature, it must succeed on a DC 19 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. As a bonus action, the Lord of the Hunt can cause his spear to magically appear in his hand, even if it is destroyed.

actions.name: Howling Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range 150/600 ft, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.desc: The Lord of the Hunt adds 3 to his AC against one attack that would hit him. To do so, he must see the attackerand must be weilding a melee weapon.

legendary_actions.name: Strike
legendary_actions.desc: The Lord of the Hunt makes a huntsman's spear attack or a howling longbow.

legendary_actions.name: Tenacious Strike
legendary_actions.desc: The Lord of the Hunt moves half his speed, or half the speed of any steed he rides.

legendary_actions.name: Call the Hunt (2 actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The Lord of the Hunt blows his hunting horn and chooses one creature he can see within 60 feet. If the creature can hear the horn, it must succeed on a DC 16 Charisma saving throw against this magic or be charmed by the Lord of the Hunt for 8 hours. A charmed creature joins the wild hunt, and follows the verbal instructions of the Lord of the Hunt, treating all former allies as enemies. If a charmed creature damages or is damaged by a former ally, it can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once a creature successfully saves or the effect ends for it, it is immune to Call of the Hunt for the next 24 hours.

name: Moonlit King
damage_resistances: acid; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from weapons that aren't made of cold iron.
senses: blightsight 30 ft, darkvision 120 ft, passive Perception 20
languages: Abyssal, Celestial, Common, Draconic, Elvish, Infernal, Umbral; telepathy 100 ft.

special_abilities.name: Control Moonlight
special_abilities.desc: As a bonus action, the Moonlit King can cause all areas of moonlight within 100 feet to move up to 10 feet.

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.desc:
The Moonlit King's innate spellcasting ability score is Charisma (save DC19, +11 to hit with spell attacks). The Moonlit King can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components.

At will: continual flame, detect evil and good, invisibility (self only), moonbeam, zone of truth
3/day each: blight, dispel evil and good, dispel
1/day each: demiplane, heal

special_abilities.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day)
special_abilities.desc: It the Moonlit King fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

special_abilities.name: Magic Weapons
special_abilities.desc: The Moonlit King's weapon attacks are magical, and deal an extra 7 (2d6) radiant damage (included below).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The Moonlit King makes three attacks with either his crystal staff or his moon bolt.

actions.name: Crystal Staff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) radiant damage. A target that is struck by the staff two or more times in one turn must make a successful DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Moon Bolt
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +11 to hit, range 150/600 ft, one target. Hit: 22 (4d10) radiant damage. If the target is a creature in a form other than its natural form, it takes an additional 22 (4d10) radiant damage and must succeed on a DC 19 Charisma saving throw or revert to its natural form. When the moon bolt hits a target, moonlight glows in a 10-feet radius from that point, creating dim light. The light is stationary and lasts until the end of the Moonlit King's next turn.

actions.name: Fearful Shadows (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The Moonlit King magically animates the shadows of all foes within 60 feet of himself. The animated shadows attack the creatures who cast them. All affected creaetures in the area take 35 (10d6) necrotic damage, or half damage with a successfull DC 19 Dexterity saving throw. A creature that fails the saving throw also loses 1d4 points from its Strength score. A creature reduced to 0 Strength is unconscious until it regains at least 1 point of Strength. Strength lost to fearful shadows returns when the creature finishes a short or long rest.

actions.name: Summon Devil (1/Day)
actions.desc: The Moonlit King magically summons a lunar devil. The summoned devil appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can't summon other devils. It remains for 10 minutes, until its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

reaction.name: Shadow Slip
reaction.desc: The Moonlit King takes on the quality of his manifest delusions when he is targeted by an attacker he can see. He becomes nearly insubstantial, so that the attack roll is made with disadvantage. If the attack hits, the Moonlit King takes half damage.

legendary_actions.name: Staff
legendary_actions.desc: The Moonlit King makes a crystal staff attack.

legendary_actions.name: Lightwalking
legendary_actions.desc: The Moonlight King teleports from one area of moonlight to another within 100 feet.

legendary_actions.name: Aura of Madness (2 actions)
legendary_actions.desc: While he is standing in an area of moonlight, the Moonlit King can spread his madness to other creatures within 30 feet. A creature other than a fiend that starts its turn in the aura or enters it for the first time on a turn (including when the aura is created) must succeed on a DC 19 Charisma saving throw or be confused (as if affected by the confusion spell) until the start of its next turn. The aura lasts until the start of the Moonlit King's next turn.

name: Queen of Night and Magic
damage_resistances: fire, lightning
damage_immunities: cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from weapons that aren't made of cold iron
languages: Celestial, Common, Elvish, Sylvan, Umbral; telepathy 120 ft.

special_abilities.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day)
special_abilities.desc: If the Queen of Night and Magic fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.desc: The Queen of Night and Magic has advantage on saving throws against spells.

special_abilities.name: Shadowborn
special_abilities.desc: When in lighting other than bright light, the Queen of Night and Magic has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide, and she can hide even while being observed.

special_abilities.name: Spellcasting
special_abilities.desc:
The Queen of Night and Magic is an 18th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 23, +15 to hit with spell attacks). The Queen knows the following sorcerer spells:

Cantrips (at will): blade ward, chill touch, dancing lights, mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost
1st level (4 slots): mage armor, magic missile, shield
2nd level (3 slots): darkness, mirror image, shield
3rd level (3 slots): blink, fear
4th level (3 slots): confusion, greater invisibility
5th level (3 slots): cone of cold, teleportation circle
6th level (1 slot): circle of death
7th level (1 slot): plane shift, prismatic spray
8th level (1 slot): dominate monster
9th level (1 slot): meteor swarm

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The Queen of Night and Magic makes three attacks with her rapier or with star strike.

actions.name: Rapier
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) cold damage.

actions.name: Shadow Rift (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The Queen of Night and Magic creaets a shadowy rift in a 20-foot sphere. Any creature within the rift takes 72 (16d8) cold damage, or half damage with a successful DC 23 Constitution saving throw. Creatures that fail the saving throw are also restrained by icy wisps of shadow. A restrained creature repeats the saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the restrained condition on a success.

actions.name: Star Strike
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +15 to hit, range 120 ft, one target. Hit: 9 (2d8) fire damage plus 9 (2d8) radiant damage.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.desc: The Queen of Night and Magic teleports to an unoccupied space up to 60 feet away.

actions.name: Unravel
actions.desc: The Queen of Night and Magic targets a creature, object, or magical effect that she can see. For every spell affecting the target, the Queen makes a Charisma check: the DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the spell is dispelled.

reactions.name: Sudden Fraying
reactions.desc: When the Queen of Night and Magic is targeted by a spell or included in a spell's area, she can use her Unravel ability on it. The Queen does not need to see a spice to target it with this reaction, but she must be able to see at least some portion of an area or object affected by the spell.

legendary_actions.name: Cantrip
legendary_actions.desc: The Queen of Night and Magic makes one star strike attack. Having a foe within 5 feet of the Queen doesn't cause this attack to be made with disadvantage.

legendary_actions.name: Swirling Stars
legendary_actions.desc: The Queen of Night and Magic makes one star strike attack. Having a foe within 5 feet of the Queen doesn't cause this attack to be made with disadvantage.

legendary_actions.name: Teleport
legendary_actions.desc: The Queen of Night and Magic uses her Teleport ability.

legendary_actions.name: Spell (2 actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The Queen of Night and Magic casts a spell.

name: Queen of Witches
damage_resistances: fire, cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from weapons that aren't cold iron
languages: Celestial, Common, Draconic, Elvish, Sylvan, Umbral

special_abilities.name: Absorb the Weave
special_abilities.desc: When Nicnevin counters or dispels a spell, she heals damage equal to twice the spell level.

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.desc:
Nicnevin's spellcasting attribute is Charisma (save DC 19, +12 to hit with spell attacks). She can innateley cast the following spells, requiring no material components.

At will: faerie fire, hex, misty step, silent image, tongues
1/day each: power word kill, sleep (9th level), true polymorph
2/day each: bestow curse, feeblemind, mass suggestion, flesh to stone
3/day each: chain lightning, counterspell, dispel magic, hypnotic pattern, teleportation circle

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.desc: Nicnevin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

special_abilities.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day)
special_abilities.desc: If Nicnevin fails a saving throw she can choose to succeed instead.

special_abilities.name: Token of Favor
special_abilities.desc: As an action, Nicnevin can cut a lock of her copper hair and twist it into a token for a creature she chooses. As long as that creature carries the token, it gains the magic resistance trait (see above). Nicnevin can revoke her favor at any time as a bonus action. When that happens, the creature loses the benefit of the token and, if Nicnevin wishes, the creature also has disadvantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects for 24 hours.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Nicnevin makes two attacks, or makes one attack and casts a spell

actions.name: Moonsilver Ring
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft, one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) radiant damage. The moonsilver ring is a magical weapon.

actions.name: Blast
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +12 to hit, range 120 ft, one target. Hit: 11 (1d10 + 6) force damage. A creature hit by a blast must succeed on a DC 19 Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet directly away from Nicnevin.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: Nicnevin makes one attack.

legendary_actions.name: Spell (2 actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Nicnevin casts a spell.

legendary_actions.name: Teleport
legendary_actions.desc: Nicnevin magically teleports to an unoccupied space she car see within 40 feet.

name: River King
damage_resistances: fire, cold, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from weapons that aren't cold iron
senses: blindsight 10 ft, darkvision 60 ft, passive Perception 16

special_abilities.name: Amphibious
special_abilities.desc: The River King can breathe air and water

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.desc:
The River King's innate spellcasting ability score is Charisma (save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). The River King can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components.

At will: create or destroy water, shocking grasp, water breathing
3/day each: freedom of movement, control water
1/day each: chain lightning

special_abilities.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day)
special_abilities.desc: If the River King fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

special_abilities.name: Magic Weapons
special_abilities.desc: The River King's weapon attacks are magical and do an extra 10 (3d6) lightning damage (included below).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The River King makes three attacks with his longsword and/or flood blash, in any combination

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: + 10 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) slaashing damage or 10 (1d10 + 5) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 10 (3d6) lightning damage.

actions.name: Flood Blash
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, range 120 ft, one target. Hit: 18 (4d8) bludgeoning damage. A target creature must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone and shifted up to 60 feet at the River King's choosing.

actions.name: Grasping Whirlpool (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The River King magically creates a swirling vortex of water centered on a point he can see within 60 feet. The vortex fills a clinder with a 10-foot radius and 15 feet high. Creatures in the area must make a successful DC 16 Strength saving throw or take 11 (2d10) bludgeoning damage and be restrained and unable to breathe. On a successful save, the creature is pushed to the edge of the area. A restrained creature can escape from the whirlpool by using an action to make a successful DC 16 Strength check. A creature that's in the whirlpool at the end of its turn takes 11 (2d10) bludgeoning damage in addition to any effects from being unable to breathe. Creatures with a swim speed have advantage on the saving throw and the Strength check to escape. The whirlpool lasts for 1 minute or until the River King uses this ability again.

reactions.name: Blade Current
reactions.desc: When a creature within the River King's melee reach stands up from prone, the River King can make a longsword attack on that creature with advantage.

legendary_actions.name: Longsword.
legendary_actions.desc: The River King makes a longsword attack

legendary_actions.name: Flow
legendary_actions.desc: The River King moves half his speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary_actions.name: Ripple (2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The River King magically ripples like sunlight on the surface of the water. Until the start of his next turn, all attacks against him have disadvantage.

name: Snow Queen
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons that aren't cold iron
senses: blindsight 10 ft, darkvision 60 ft, passive Perception 20

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.desc:
The Snow Queen's innate spellcasting ability score is Charisma (save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). The Snow Queen can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components.

At will: fog cloug, magic missile, ray of frost
3/day each: chill metal (as heat metal, but does cold damage), freezing sphere,
1/day: cone of cold

special_abilities.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day)
special_abilities.desc: If the Snow Queen fails a saving trow, she can choose to succeed instead.

special_abilities.name: Magic Weapons
special_abilities.desc: The Snow Queen's weapon attacks are magical and doan extra 7 (2d6) cold damage (included below)

special_abilities.name: Winter Step
special_abilities.desc: The Snow Queen ignores difficult terrain caused by ice and snow. She can walk on vertical and horizontal surfaces that are covered by ice or snow.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The Snow Queen makes two attacks in any combination of her claws and her ice crown.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit,reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) cold damage

actions.name: Ice Crown
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 80/320ft, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) cold damage. The target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Cold Snap (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The Snow Queen causes the temperature around her to drop dramatically. Every creature within 30 feet of the Snow Queen must make a successful DC 17 Constitution saving throw or gain 1 level of exhaustion. Immunity to cold grants immunity to Cold Snap.

reactions.name: Frozen Shards
reactions.desc: When the Snow Queen is hit by a melee attack, she canstrike her attacker with shards from her icy crown.The attacker takes 11 (2d10) piercingdamage and 11 (2d10) cold damage, or no damage with asuccessful DC 17 Dexterity saving throw.

legendary_actions.name: Ice Crown
legendary_actions.desc: The Snow Queen makes an ice crown attack.

legendary_actions.name: Snowblind
legendary_actions.desc: One target that the Snow Queen can see within 100 feet must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be blinded by swirling snow until the end of its next.

legendary_actions.name: Snowfall Mantle (2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The Snow Queen throws her mantle of snow at a point she can see within 60 feet. An area within 30 feet of that point instantly becomes covered in deep snow. Creatures in the area must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be restrained. The area becomes difficult terrain, costing 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot moved. The difficult terrain lasts until the end of the Snow Queen's next turn, at which time her mantle returns to her shoulders.

name: Feyward
damage_immunities: poison, psychic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine
condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.desc: A feyward tree has advantage on saving throws aganist spells and other magical effects.

special_abilities.name: Contractibility and Conductivity
special_abilities.desc:
Certain spells and effects function differently against feyward trees:

• A magical attack that deals cold damage slows a feyward tree (as the slow spell) for 3 rounds.
• A magical attack that deals lightning damage breaks any slow effect on the feyward tree and heals 1 hit point for each 3 damage the attack would otherwise deal. If the amount of healing would cause the tree to exceed its full normal hp, it gains any excess as temporary hp. The tree gets no saving throw against lightning effects.

special_abilities.name: Immutable Form
special_abilities.desc: The feyward tree is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

special_abilities.name: Magic Weapons
special_abilities.desc: The feyward tree's weapon attacks are magical

special_abilities.name: Warden's Reach
special_abilities.desc: Creatures within 15 feet of a feyward tree provoke opportunity attacks even if they take the Disengage action before leaving its reach.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The tree makes two razor-leafed branch attacks, and may use a bonus action to make a razor-eafed branch attack against any creature standing next to it.

actions.name: Razor-Leafed Branch
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 15 ft, one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) slashing damage.

actions.name: Flaying Leaves (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The tree can launch a barrage of razor-sharp cold iron leaves from its branches in a 20-foot-radius burst. All creatures caught within this area must make a successful DC 16 Dexterity saving throw or take 21 (6d6) slashing damage, or half as much damage on a successful one.

name: Firebird
damage_resistances: lightning; bludgeoning,piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.desc:
The firebird's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: guidance, purify food and drink, speak with animals
3/day: charm person, cure woulds (2d8 + 5), daylight, faerie fire, heat metal, hypnotic pattern, tongues
1/day: geas, heat, reincarnate

special_abilities.name: Light of the World
special_abilities.desc: The firebird's feathers glow with a warm light, the creature sheds light as dim as a candle or as bright as a lantern. It always sheds light and any feathers plucked from the creature continue to shed light as a torch.

special_abilities.name: Warming Presence
special_abilities.desc: The fireird and any creatures within a 5-foot radius are immune to the effects of natural environmental cold. Invited into a home or building, a firebird canexpand this warming presence to its inhabitants no matter how close they are to the creature.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The firebird makes one bite attack and two claw attacks

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 10 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Blinding Ray (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The firebird can fire a burning ray of light from its tail feathers in a line 5 feet wide and up to 50 feet long. Targets in the line must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 24 (7d6) fire damage and become blinded for 1d4 rounds. A successful saving throw negates the blindness and reduces the damage by half.

name: Firegeist
condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious

special_abilities.name: Hide By Firelight
special_abilities.desc: In an area lit only by nonmagical flame, a firegeist gainst a +2 bonus on Stealth checks. This becomes +4 when hiding with the fire.

special_abilities.name: Illumination
special_abilities.desc: The firegeist sheds dim light in a 30-foot radius.

special_abilities.name: Magical Light Sensitivity
special_abilities.desc: A firegeist detests magical light of any intensity. It suffers the effects of being poisoned when inside the radius of a magical light source.

special_abilities.name: Water Susceptibility
special_abilities.desc: For every 5 feet the firegeist moves in water, or every gallon of water splashing on in, it takes 3 cold damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The firegeist makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Combustion Touch (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The firegeist may ignite a target when making a slam attack. The target must immediately succeed at a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or catch fire, taking an additional 5 (1d10) fire damage at the beginnning of its next turn. Until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the creature takes 5 (1d10) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

name: Flutterflesh
damage_resistances: cold, lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
condition_immunities: charmed, paralyzed, exhaustion, poison, stunned, unconscious

special_abilities.name: Magic Weapons
special_abilities.desc: The flutterflesh's attacks are magical

special_abilities.name: Turn Resistance
special_abilities.desc: The flutterflesh has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead

special_abilities.name: Regeneration
special_abilities.desc: The flutterflesh regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the flutterflesh takes radiant or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The flutterflesh dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The flutterflesh makes two bone spur attacks or two tormenting gaze attacks.

actions.name: Bone Spur
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) slashing damage plus 11 (2d10) necrotic damage. If both attacks hit a single creature in the same turn, it is grappled (escape DC 10). As a bonus action, the flutterflesh can choose whether this attack does bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage.

actions.name: Tormenting Gaze
actions.desc: A target creature within 120 feet and able to see the flutterflesh takes 18 (4d8) psychic damage and is paralyze for 1d4 rounds, or takes half damage and isn't paralyzed with a successful DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. Tormenting gaze can't be used against the same target twice in a single turn.

actions.name: Slash
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage. On a critical hit, the target takes an additional 27 (5d10) slashing damage and must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the flutterflesh lops off and absorbs one of the target's limbs (chosen randomly) and heals hit points equal to the additional slashing damage it inflicted.

name: Folk of Leng
damage_resistances: cold

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.desc:
The folk of Leng's innates spellcasting abilty is Charisma (spell save DC 16). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: comprehend languages, minor illusion
3/day each: disguise self, suggestion
1/day each: dream, etherealness

special_abilities.name: Regeneration
special_abilities.desc: The folk of Leng regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn. If the folk of Leng takes fire or radiant damage, this trait does not function at the start of its next turn. The folk of Leng dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points, and does not regenerate. Even if slain, their bodies reform in a crypt of Leng and go on about their business.

special_abilities.name: Void Stare
special_abilities.desc: The folk of Leng can see through doors and around corners as a bonus action. As a result, they are very rarely surprised.

special_abilities.name: Void Sailors
special_abilities.desc: The folk of Leng can travel the airless void without harm.

actions.name: Etheric Harpoon
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 30 ft, one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) necrotic damage, and the target must make a successful DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be grappled (escape DC 13). In addition, armor has no effect against the attack roll of an etheric harpoon; only the Dexterity modifier factored into the target's AC is considered.

actions.name: Psychic Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) psychic damage.

actions.name: Hooked Spider Net (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 20/50 ft, one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) piercing damage plus 19 (3d12) poison damage, and the target is restrained. A successful DC 14 Constitution saving throw halves the poison damage.

special_abilities.name: Light Sensitivity
special_abilities.desc: While in bright light, the marauder has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The forest marauder makes two boar spear attacks.

actions.name: Bone Spear
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft, one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage, and the forest marauder can choose to push the target 10 feet away if it fails a DC 16 Strength saving throw.

actions.name: Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 30/120ft, one target, Hit: 19 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

special_abilities.name: Frost Walker
special_abilities.desc: The fraughashar speed is unimpeded by rocky, snowy, or icy terrain. It never needs to make Dexterity checks, to move or avoid falling prone because of icy or snowy ground.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The fraughashar makes one bite attack and one dagger attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5ft, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Sling
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

name: Frostveil
damage_resistances: bludgeoning and piercing from nonmagical weapons

special_abilities.name: Chilling Acid
special_abilities.desc: The frostveil's frozen acidic mist breaks down flesh and organic materials into useable nurtrients. Creatures who strike the frostveil with a non-reach melee weapon on an unarmed strike take 4 (1d8) acid damage.

special_abilities.name: Freeze
special_abilities.desc: Aganst snowy ground or when flying in a blizzard, the frostveil has advantage on Stealth checks to hide in plain sight, appearing to be a patch of snow.

special_abilities.name: Windborne
special_abilities.desc: Frostveils can catch the slightest breeze, but lack the motive power to fly unaided. Their fly speed is dependent on the local wind: Light (10 feet), Moderate (20 feet), Strong (40 feet), Severe (60 feet), Windstorm (80 feet), Hurricane (100 feet), or Tornado (120 feet). They cannot move directly against the wind but can tack at half speed.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The frostveil makes three tendril attacks.

actions.name: Tendril
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If two tendrils hit the same target in a single turn, the target is engulfed.

actions.name: Engulf
actions.desc: When a frostveil wraps itself around a Medium or smaller creature, the target takes 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 13 (3d8) acid damage and is grappled (escape DC 15). The target takes another 9 (2d8) bludgeoning damage plus 13 (3d8) acid damage at the end of each of its turns while it's still grappled by the frostveil. A frostveil can't attack while it has a creature egulfed. Damage from attacks against the frostveil is split evenly between the frostveil and the engulfed creature; the only exceptions are slashing and psychic damage, which affect only the frostveil.

actions.name: Spirit Spores (recharge 6)
actions.desc: In distress, frostveils release a puff of psychotropic spores in a 10-foot cloud around themselves. Creatures within the cloud of spores must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw against poison or suffer hallucinations, as per a confusion spell, for 1d3 rounds.

special_abilities.name: Amphibious
special_abilities.desc: The crab can breathe air and water

actions.name: Whip-claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 8). While grappled, the target cannot speak or cast spells with verbal components.

special_abilities.name: Chameleon Hide
special_abilities.desc: The gbahali has advatage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. If the gbahali moves one-half its speed or less, attacks made against it before the start of the gbhali's next turn have disadvantage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The gbahali makes one bite attack and two claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft, one target. Hit: 24 (3d12 + 5) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 15). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the gbahali can't bite another target.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage.

name: Gearforged Templar
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons

special_abilities.name: Defensive Zone
special_abilities.desc: The gearforged templar can make an opportunity attack when a creature enters its reach.

special_abilities.name: Onslaught
special_abilities.desc: As a bonus action, the gearforged can make a Shove attack.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The gearforged templar makes three attacks with its glaive.

actions.name: Glaive
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft, one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 30/120 ft, one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Whirlwind (recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The gearforged templar whirls its glaive in a great arc. Every creature within 10 feet of the gearforged takes 16 (3d10) slashing damage, or half damage with a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.desc: The gearforged templar raises its AC by 3 against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the gearforged must be ale to see the attacker and must be wielding a melee weapon.

special_abilities.name: Air Hatred
special_abilities.desc: The al-Aeshma has advantage on attack rolls against airborne opponents.

special_abilities.name: Bound
special_abilities.desc: The al-Aeshma must always be anchored to the earth. Even in gaseous form or sandstorm form, part of it must always touch the ground. The al-Aeshma's maximum altitude while flying is 50ft. If it is not touching, it gains vulnerability to lightning and thunder.

special_abilities.name: Elemental Demise
special_abilities.desc: When an al-Aeshma dies, its body disintegrates into a swirling spray of coarse sand, leaving behind equipmment it was wearing or carrying.

special_abilities.name: Ill Wild
special_abilities.desc: As a onus action when in gaseous form, the al-Aeshma can befoul its space with a choking scent. When the al-Aeshma moves through another creature's space in gaseous form, the creature must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or be incapacitated until the end of its next turn. Ill Wind lasts until the al-Aeshma leaves gaseous form, or chooses to end the ability as a bonus action.

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.desc:
The al-Aeshma's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). It can innately cast the following, requiring no material components:
At will: detect evil and good, detect magic, thunderwave
3/day each: destroy food and water (as create food and water, but makes food and drink unpalatable), tongues, wind walk
1/day each: creation, gaseous form, insect plague, invisiility, major image

special_abilities.name: Regeneration
special_abilities.desc: The al-Aeshma regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If it takes fire or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The al-Aeshma dies only if it starts its turn at 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The al-Aeshma makes three scimitar attacks.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage, plus 3 (1d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Dust Devil
actions.desc: A 5-foot radius, 30-foot tall cylinder of sand magically forms on a point the al_aeshma can see within 120 feet of it. The dust devil lasts as long as the al-Aeshma maintains concentration (as if a spell). Any creature but the al-Aeshma that enters the dust devil must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or be restrained by it; any number of creatures may be restrained this way. At the start of a restrained creature's turn, it takes 7 (2d6) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage. The al-Aeshma can move the dust devil up to 60 feet as an action; restrained creatures move with it. The dust devil ends if the al-Aeshma loses sight of it. A creature can use its action to free a creature restrained by the dust devil, including itself, by making a DC 18 Strength check. If the check succeeds, it moves to the nearest space outside the dust devil.

special_abilities.name: Bred to the Saddle
special_abilities.desc: Geridae do not take any penalties to their movement or speed due to encumbrance or carrying a single rider.

special_abilities.name: Waterborne
special_abilities.desc: Any gerridae can run while on the surface of water, but not while on land or climbing. They treat stormy water as normal rather than difficult terrain. A gerridae takes one point of damage for every hour spent on dry land.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The gerridae makes one bite attack and one claw attack

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) slashing damage.

special_abilities.name: Pack Tactics
special_abilities.desc: The beggar ghoul has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one other allied beggar ghoul is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

special_abilities.name: Savage Hunter
special_abilities.desc: A beggar ghoul that hits with its bite attack against a creature that hasn't acted yet in this combat scores a critical hit.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5ft, one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an elf or undead, it must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. A paralyzed target repeals the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the affect on itself on a success.

name: Bonepowder Ghoul
damage_resistances: cold, lightning; bludgeoning piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

special_abilities.name: Amorphous
special_abilities.desc: The Bonepowder ghoul can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

special_abilities.name: Coalesce
special_abilities.desc: Whenever a bonepowder ghoul drains life force from victims with Gravedust, it can use that energy transform its shape into a more solid form and maintain it. The new form is Small and semi-transparent but roughly the shape of a normal ghoul. In this form, the ghoul isn't amorphous and can't form a whirlwind, but it can speak normally and manipulate objects. The altered form lasts for 1 minute for every point of necrotic damage it delivered against living foes.

special_abilities.name: Turning Defiance
special_abilities.desc: The bonepowder ghoul and any other ghouls within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.desc:
The bonepowder ghoul's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells requiring no material components.

At will: chill touch, darkness, dispel magic, ray of enfeeblement
3/day: blindness/deafness, circle of death (7th level; 10d6)
1/day: finger of death

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) plus 1d4 Strength damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1d4 + 1 rounds. If the target creature is humanoid, it must succeed on a second DC 19 Constitution saving throw or contract darakhul fever.

actions.name: Gravedust
actions.desc: A bonepowder ghoul can project a 40-ft. cone of grave dust. All targets within the area must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw to avoid taking 4d8 necrotic damage, and must make a second DC 17 Constitution saving throw to avoid being infected with darakhul fever.

actions.name: Whirlwind (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: A bonepowder ghoul can generate a whirlwind of bones and teeth. All creatures within a 20-foot cube take 66 (12d10) slashing damage and are drained of 1d6 Strength; a successful DC 17 saving throw reduces damage to half and negates the Strength loss. The whirlwind dissipates after one round.

name: Ghoul, Darakhul
damage_resistances: necrotic

special_abilities.name: Master of Disguise
special_abilities.desc: A darakhul in a prepared disguise has advantage on Charisma (Deception) checks made to pass as a living creature. While using this ability, the darakhul loses its stench.

special_abilities.name: Stench
special_abilities.desc: Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the darakhul must make a successful DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. A successful saving throw makes the creature immune to the darakhul's stench for 24 hours. A darakhul using this ability can't also benefit from Master of Disguise.

special_abilities.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
special_abilities.desc: The darakhul has disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight and on attack rolls while it, the object it is trying to see or attack in direct sunlight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The darakhul bites once, claws once, and makes one war pick attack. Using a shield limits the darakhul to making either its claws or war picks attack, but now both.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage, and if the target creature is humanoid it must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or contract darakhul fever.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead, it must make a successful DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. A paralyzed target repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a humanoid creature is paralyzed for 2 or more rounds (the victim fails at least 2 saving throws), consecutive or nonconsecutive, the creature contracts darakhul fever.

actions.name: War Pick
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

name: Ghoul, Emperor
damage_resistances: cold, necrotic
damage_immunities: poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons

special_abilities.name: Spellcasting
special_abilities.desc:
The emperor is a 17-th level spellcaster. His spellcasting attribute is Charisma (spell save DC 19), +11 to hit with spell attacks). The emperor knows the following sorcerer spells:

Cantrips (at will): blade ward, chill touch, message, prestidigitation, shocking grasp, true strike
1st level (4 slots): magic missile, shield
2nd level (3 slots): mirror image, phantasmal force
3rd level (3 slots): fear, fireball
4th level (3 slots): blight, dimension door
5th level (2 slots): cloudkill, hold monster
6th level (1 slot): circle of death, teleport
8th level (1 slot): power word stun
9th level (1 slot): power word kill

special_abilities.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
special_abilities.desc: While in direct sunlight, the emperor has disadvantage on attack rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

special_abilities.name: Turn resistance
special_abilities.desc: The emperor has advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The emperor makes one bite attack and two claw attacks. He can make one attack with its scepter in place of a claw attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage, and a creature must make a successful DC 18 Constitution saving throw or contract darakhul fever.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage, and a creature must make a successful DC 18 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. A paralyzed creature repeats the saving throw at the ends of its turn, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Scepter
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 17 (5d6) necrotic damage.

reactions.name: Blood Armor
reactions.desc: When the emperor takes damage from a creature it can see within 60 feet, the attacker takes necrotic damage equal to half the damage it did to the emperor.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The emperor makes one claw or bite attack

legendary_actions.name: Cantrip
legendary_actions.desc: The emperor casts a cantrip.

legendary_actions.name: Font of Power (3 actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Roll 1d8. The emperor regains a spell slot of that level or lower.

special_abilities.name: Turning Defiance
special_abilities.desc: The imperial ghoul makes one bite attack and one claws attack.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The imperial ghoul makes one bite attack and one claws attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage, and if the target creature is humanoid it must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or contract darakhul fever.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon

actions.name: Light Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 80/320, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

special_abilities.name: Amphibious
special_abilities.desc: The glass gator can breathe air and water.

special_abilities.name: Lunge
special_abilities.desc: When the glass gator leaps at least 10 feet toward a creature and hits that creature with a claws attack on the same turn, it can immediately constrict the target as a bonus action.

special_abilities.name: Transparency
special_abilities.desc: The glass gator has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks while underwater or in dim light.

special_abilities.name: Standing Leap
special_abilities.desc: The glass gator can long jump up to 15 feet from the water or up to 10 feet on land, with or without a running start.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage and the target is grappled (escape DC 12). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and the glass gator can't attack a different target.

actions.name: Constrict
actions.desc: One creature that's already grappled by the glass gator takes 7 (2d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage, or half as much poison damage with a succesful DC 11 Constitution saving throw.

reactions.name: Silt Cloud (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
reactions.desc: After taking damage while in water, the glass gator thrashes to stir up a 10-foot radius cloud of silt around itself. The area inside the sphere is heavily obscured for 1 minute (10 rounds) in still water or 5 (2d4) rounds in a strong current. After stirring up the silt, the glass gator can move its speed.
